00024 #ifdef HAVE_CONFIG_H
00025 #include <config.h>
00026 #endif
00027 
00028 /* #include "getopt.h"*/
00029 #include "gnugetopt.h" 
00030 
00031 
00032 #if !defined __STDC__ || !__STDC__
00033 /* This is a separate conditional since some stdc systems
00034    reject `defined (const)'.  */
00035 #ifndef const
00036 #define const
00037 #endif
00038 #endif
00039 
00040 #include <stdio.h>
00041 
00042 /* Comment out all this code if we are using the GNU C Library, and are not
00043    actually compiling the library itself.  This code is part of the GNU C
00044    Library, but also included in many other GNU distributions.  Compiling
00045    and linking in this code is a waste when using the GNU C library
00046    (especially if it is a shared library).  Rather than having every GNU
00047    program understand `configure --with-gnu-libc' and omit the object files,
00048    it is simpler to just do this in the source for each such file.  */
00049 
00050 #define GETOPT_INTERFACE_VERSION 2
00051 #if !defined _LIBC && defined __GLIBC__ && __GLIBC__ >= 2
00052 #include <gnu-versions.h>
00053 #if _GNU_GETOPT_INTERFACE_VERSION == GETOPT_INTERFACE_VERSION
00054 #define ELIDE_CODE
00055 #endif
00056 #endif
00057 
00058 #ifndef ELIDE_CODE
00059 
00060 
00061 /* This needs to come after some library #include
00062    to get __GNU_LIBRARY__ defined.  */
00063 #ifdef __GNU_LIBRARY__
00064 #include <stdlib.h>
00065 #endif
00066 
00067 #ifndef NULL
00068 #define NULL 0
00069 #endif
00070 
00071 int
00072 getopt_long (argc, argv, options, long_options, opt_index)
00073      int argc;
00074      char *const *argv;
00075      const char *options;
00076      const struct option *long_options;
00077      int *opt_index;
00078 {
00079   return _getopt_internal (argc, argv, options, long_options, opt_index, 0);
00080 }
00081 
00082 /* Like getopt_long, but '-' as well as '--' can indicate a long option.
00083    If an option that starts with '-' (not '--') doesn't match a long option,
00084    but does match a short option, it is parsed as a short option
00085    instead.  */
00086 
00087 int
00088 getopt_long_only (argc, argv, options, long_options, opt_index)
00089      int argc;
00090      char *const *argv;
00091      const char *options;
00092      const struct option *long_options;
00093      int *opt_index;
00094 {
00095   return _getopt_internal (argc, argv, options, long_options, opt_index, 1);
00096 }
00097 
00098 
00099 #endif  /* Not ELIDE_CODE.  */
00100 
00101 #ifdef TEST
00102 
00103 #include <stdio.h>
00104 
00105 int
00106 main (argc, argv)
00107      int argc;
00108      char **argv;
00109 {
00110   int c;
00111   int digit_optind = 0;
00112 
00113   while (1)
00114     {
00115       int this_option_optind = optind ? optind : 1;
00116       int option_index = 0;
00117       static struct option long_options[] =
00118       {
00119         {"add", 1, 0, 0},
00120         {"append", 0, 0, 0},
00121         {"delete", 1, 0, 0},
00122         {"verbose", 0, 0, 0},
00123         {"create", 0, 0, 0},
00124         {"file", 1, 0, 0},
00125         {0, 0, 0, 0}
00126       };
00127 
00128       c = getopt_long (argc, argv, "abc:d:0123456789",
00129                        long_options, &option_index);
00130       if (c == -1)
00131         break;
00132 
00133       switch (c)
00134         {
00135         case 0:
00136           printf ("option %s", long_options[option_index].name);
00137           if (optarg)
00138             printf (" with arg %s", optarg);
00139           printf ("\n");
00140           break;
00141 
00142         case '0':
00143         case '1':
00144         case '2':
00145         case '3':
00146         case '4':
00147         case '5':
00148         case '6':
00149         case '7':
00150         case '8':
00151         case '9':
00152           if (digit_optind != 0 && digit_optind != this_option_optind)
00153             printf ("digits occur in two different argv-elements.\n");
00154           digit_optind = this_option_optind;
00155           printf ("option %c\n", c);
00156           break;
00157 
00158         case 'a':
00159           printf ("option a\n");
00160           break;
00161 
00162         case 'b':
00163           printf ("option b\n");
00164           break;
00165 
00166         case 'c':
00167           printf ("option c with value `%s'\n", optarg);
00168           break;
00169 
00170         case 'd':
00171           printf ("option d with value `%s'\n", optarg);
00172           break;
00173 
00174         case '?':
00175           break;
00176 
00177         default:
00178           printf ("?? getopt returned character code 0%o ??\n", c);
00179         }
00180     }
00181 
00182   if (optind < argc)
00183     {
00184       printf ("non-option ARGV-elements: ");
00185       while (optind < argc)
00186         printf ("%s ", argv[optind++]);
00187       printf ("\n");
00188     }
00189 
00190   exit (0);
00191 }
00192 
00193 #endif /* TEST */
